refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Known Implementations
refsect1.para: TpHandleRepoIface is implemented by TpDynamicHandleRepo and TpStaticHandleRepo.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Abstract interface of a repository for handles, supporting operations which include checking for validity, reference counting, lookup by string value and lookup by numeric value. See TpDynamicHandleRepo and TpStaticHandleRepo for concrete implementations.

refsect2.title: TpHandleRepoIface
refsect2.para: Dummy typedef representing any implementation of this interface.

refsect2.title: TpHandleRepoIfaceClass
refsect2.para: The class of a handle repository interface. The structure layout is only available within telepathy-glib, for the handle repository implementations' benefit.

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
A handle of the type stored in the repository self
Set to InvalidHandle if FALSE is returned
TRUE if the handle is nonzero and is present in the repository, else FALSE

refsect2.title: tp_handles_are_valid ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_handles_are_valid (TpHandleRepoIface *self, const GArray *handles, gboolean allow_zero, GError **error);

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
Array of TpHandle representing handles of the type stored in the repository self
If TRUE, zero is treated like a valid handle
Set to InvalidHandle if FALSE is returned
TRUE if the handle is present in the repository, else FALSE

refsect2.title: tp_handles_supported_and_valid ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_handles_supported_and_valid (TpHandleRepoIface *repos[NUM_TP_HANDLE_TYPES], TpHandleType handle_type, const GArray *handles, gboolean allow_zero, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Return TRUE if the given handle type is supported (i.e. repos[handle_type] is not NULL) and the given handles are all valid in that repository. If not, set error and return FALSE.

listitem.simpara: An array of possibly null pointers to handle repositories, indexed by handle type, where a null pointer means an unsupported handle type
The handle type
A GArray of guint representing handles of the given type
If TRUE, zero is treated like a valid handle
Used to return an error if FALSE is returned
TRUE if the handle type is supported and the handles are all valid.

refsect2.title: tp_handle_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increase the reference count of the given handle, which must be present in the repository. For repository implementations which never free handles (like TpStaticHandleRepo) this has no effect.

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
A handle of the type stored in the repository

refsect2.title: tp_handles_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increase the reference count of the given handles. If a handle appears multiple times in handles it will be referenced that many times. If any zero entries appear in handles they will be ignored without error; it is an error for any other invalid handle to appear in handles.

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
A GArray of TpHandle representing handles

refsect2.title: tp_handle_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrease the reference count of the given handle. If it reaches zero, delete the handle. It is an error to attempt to unref a handle which is not present in the repository.
For repository implementations which never free handles (like TpStaticHandleRepo) this has no effect.

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
A handle of the type stored in the repository

refsect2.title: tp_handles_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrease the reference count of the given handles. If a handle appears multiple times in handles it will be dereferenced that many times. If any zero entries appear in handles they will be ignored without error; it is an error for any other invalid handle to appear in handles.

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
A GArray of TpHandle representing handles

refsect2.title: tp_handle_client_hold ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_handle_client_hold (TpHandleRepoIface *self, const gchar *client, TpHandle handle, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Hold the given handle on behalf of the named client. If the client leaves the bus, the reference is automatically discarded.

Handles held multiple times are the same as handles held once: the client either holds a handle or it doesn't. In particular, if you call tp_handle_client_hold() multiple times, then call tp_handle_client_release() just once, the client no longer holds the handle.
It is an error for handle not to be present in the repository.

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
The unique bus name of a D-Bus peer
A handle of the type stored in the repository
Set if FALSE is returned
TRUE if the client name is valid; else FALSE with error set.

refsect2.title: tp_handles_client_hold ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_handles_client_hold (TpHandleRepoIface *self, const gchar *client, const GArray *handles, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Hold the given handles on behalf of the named client. If the client leaves the bus, the reference is automatically discarded.

If any of the handles are zero they will be ignored without error. It is an error for any other invalid handle to be in handles: the caller is expected to have validated them first, e.g. using tp_handles_are_valid().
Handles appearing multiple times are the same as handles appearing once: the client either holds a handle or it doesn't.
If FALSE is returned, the reference counts of all handles are unaffected (the function either fails completely or succeeds completely).

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
The D-Bus unique name of a client
A GArray of TpHandle representing handles
Used to return an error if FALSE is returned
TRUE if the client name is valid; else FALSE with error set.

refsect2.title: tp_handle_client_release ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_handle_client_release (TpHandleRepoIface *self, const gchar *client, TpHandle handle, GError **error);
refsect2.para: If the named client holds the given handle, release it. If this causes the reference count to become zero, delete the handle.
For repository implementations which never free handles (like TpStaticHandleRepo) this has no effect.

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
The unique bus name of a D-Bus peer
A handle of the type stored in the repository
Set if FALSE is returned
TRUE if the client name is valid and the client previously held a reference to the handle, else FALSE.

refsect2.title: tp_handles_client_release ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean tp_handles_client_release (TpHandleRepoIface *self, const gchar *client, const GArray *handles, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Releases a reference to the given handles on behalf of the named client.

If any of the handles are zero they will be ignored without error. It is an error for any other invalid handle to be in handles: the caller is expected to have validated them first, e.g. using tp_handles_are_valid().
If FALSE is returned, the reference counts of all handles are unaffected (the function either fails completely or succeeds completely).

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
The D-Bus unique name of a client
A GArray of TpHandle representing handles
Used to return an error if FALSE is returned
TRUE if the client name is valid and the client previously held a reference to all the handles, else FALSE.
A handle repository implementation
A handle of the type stored in the repository

the string represented by the given handle, or NULL if the handle is absent from the repository. The string is owned by the handle repository and will remain valid as long as a reference to the handle exists.

refsect2.title: tp_handle_set_qdata ()
refsect2.programlisting: void tp_handle_set_qdata (TpHandleRepoIface *repo, TpHandle handle, GQuark key_id, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: Associates a blob of data with a given handle and a given key
If destroy is set, then the data is freed when the handle is freed.

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
A handle to set data on
Key id to associate data with
data to associate with handle
A GDestroyNotify to call to destroy the data, or NULL if not needed.

refsect2.title: tp_handle_get_qdata ()

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
A handle to get data from
Key id of data to fetch
the data associated with a given key on a given handle; NULL if there is no associated data.

refsect2.title: tp_handle_ensure ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpHandle tp_handle_ensure (TpHandleRepoIface *self, const gchar *id, gpointer context, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Return a new reference to the handle for the given string. The handle is normalized, if possible. If no such handle exists it will be created.

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
A string whose handle is required
User data to be passed to the normalization callback
Used to return an error if 0 is returned
the handle corresponding to the given string, or 0 if it is invalid.

refsect2.title: tp_handle_lookup ()
refsect2.programlisting: TpHandle tp_handle_lookup (TpHandleRepoIface *self, const gchar *id, gpointer context, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Return the handle for the given string, without incrementing its reference count. The handle is normalized if possible.

listitem.simpara: A handle repository implementation
A string whose handle is required
User data to be passed to the normalization callback
Used to raise an error if the handle does not exist or is invalid
the handle corresponding to the given string, or 0 if it does not exist or is invalid

refsect2.title: TpHandleSet
refsect2.para: A set of handles. This is similar to a TpIntSet (and implemented using one), but adding a handle to the set also references it.

refsect2.title: TpHandleSetMemberFunc ()
refsect2.para: Signature of the callback used to iterate over the handle set in tp_handle_set_foreach().

listitem.simpara: The set of handles on which tp_handle_set_foreach() was called
A handle in the set
Arbitrary user data as supplied to tp_handle_set_foreach()

refsect2.title: tp_handle_set_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new TpHandleSet

listitem.simpara: TpHandleRepo that holds the handles to be reffed by this set
A new TpHandleSet

refsect2.title: tp_handle_set_destroy ()
refsect2.para: Delete a TpHandleSet and unreference any handles that it holds

listitem.simpara: #TpHandleSet to destroy
#TpHandleSet to peek at
the underlying TpIntSet used by this TpHandleSet

refsect2.title: tp_handle_set_add ()
refsect2.para: Add a handle to a TpHandleSet,and reference it in the attched TpHandleRepo

listitem.simpara: TpHandleSet to add this handle to
handle to add

refsect2.title: tp_handle_set_remove ()
refsect2.para: Remove a handle to a TpHandleSet,and unreference it in the attched TpHandleRepo

listitem.simpara: TpHandleSet to remove this handle from
handle to remove
FALSE if the handle was invalid, or was not in this set

refsect2.title: tp_handle_set_is_member ()
refsect2.para: Check if the handle is in this set

listitem.simpara: A TpHandleSet
handle to check
TRUE if the handle is in this set

refsect2.title: tp_handle_set_foreach ()
refsect2.para: Call func(set, handle, userdata) for each handle in set.

listitem.simpara: A set of handles
A callback
Arbitrary data to pass to func
A set of handles
the number of handles in this set
A handle set
a newly-allocated GArray of guint representing the handles in the set

refsect2.title: tp_handle_set_update ()
refsect2.para: Add a set of handles to a handle set, referencing those which are not already members. The TpIntSet returned must be freed with tp_intset_destroy.

listitem.simpara: a TpHandleSet to update
a TpIntSet of handles to add
the handles which were added (some subset of add)

refsect2.title: tp_handle_set_difference_update ()
refsect2.para: Remove a set of handles from a handle set, dereferencing those which are members. The TpIntSet returned must be freed with tp_intset_destroy.

If you want to be able to inspect the handles in the set returned, you must ensure that this function does not cause their refcount to drop to zero, for instance by temporarily taking a reference to all the handles in remove, calling this function, doing something with the result and discarding the temporary references.

listitem.simpara: a TpHandleSet to update
a TpIntSet of handles to remove
the handles which were dereferenced and removed (some subset of remove).

refsect2.title: The "handle-type" property
refsect2.para: The TpHandleType held in this handle repository.
Default value: 0
